title: Best laptops 2024: Premium, budget, gaming, 2-in-1s, and more
description:
Picking up a new laptop can be an arduous task for some. How big should the screen be? Which CPU should I get? What about battery life? If you’re feeling overwhelmed, don’t sweat it, as we did much of the heavy lifting for you. Whether you’re in the market for a blazing fast gaming laptop or a portable workhorse, we’ve got something for every type of buyer.

Why you should trust us: Hey, it’s in our name! PCWorld prides itself on laptop experience and expertise. We’ve been covering PCs since 1983, and we now review more than 70 laptops every year. All of the picks below have been personally tested and vetted by our experts, who’ve applied not only performance benchmarks but rigorous usability standards. We’re also committed to reviewing PC laptops at every price point to help you f

title: Windows 11’s taskbar has an annoying bug, but it’s getting fixed
description:
The new Windows 11 Insider Preview Build 22635.3212 for testers doesn’t bring any spectacular new features, but Microsoft has fixed an annoying problem that is causing problems for some Windows 11 users, as Betanews writes.

Get windows 11 pro for cheap

title: Best gaming headsets 2024: Reviews and buying advice
description:
Most people when trying to maximize their gaming experience focus on the quality of the game and their computer’s processing power. But an often-overlooked variable that can greatly affect the experience is a decent gaming headset. It’s especially important if you plan on getting the best out of multiplayer games, where you’re just as likely to use your headset to chat with friends as you are to use it as a strategic tool to help you win.

As you’d expect, there’s no shortage of gaming headsets out there. No one wants to wade through the myriad options only to settle on one that ends up leaving you disappointed. That’s why I’ve done all the heavy lifting for you, testing a ton of different headsets to find the best.

Why should you trust me? Because I’m a hardcore gamer

title: Gmail: How to schedule emails to send at specific times
description:
Nudgemail is a smart service that we first wrote about back in 2010. Instead of putting reminders in your calendar, you send an email to Nudgemail and then get a reminder email back at the time you choose. However, Nudgemail has now announced that it’s shutting down the service, at least temporarily.

But if you have a modern email service like Gmail, the same function is built in from the start. It is called Scheduling and allows you to send emails at a later time. The basic idea, of course, is that you can email others at a more convenient time, but you can also use the feature to email yourself. Here’s what you do:

title: Score this everyday HP laptop with an OLED display for $570 off
description:
Everyday laptops are perfect for the casual user because they’re designed to handle day-to-day tasks like browsing the web and watching Netflix. If you happen to be in the market for an everyday laptop, you’re in luck, as I happened to find a pretty good deal on one today. HP’s selling the HP Pavilion Plus for $749.99, which is a mega savings of $570. Not only does it have a gorgeous OLED display, but it’s also rocking an Nvidia GeForce RTX 2050 GPU. Sure, it’s not the most powerful graphics card we’ve ever seen, but it’s still a nice little boost for an everyday laptop.

The

title: Does fast charging hurt your phone battery?
description:
The fast charging function is, without a doubt, one of the most popular trend features of modern smartphones. That’s understandable, as it’s more than practical during the day when you don’t have to wait for an eternity to fully charge your phone.

The whole thing has now gone so far that there is a real competition between manufacturers to see who can provide the best and most powerful charging technology. At last year’s MWC, Xiaomi demonstrated its impressive charging technology, which pumped a Redmi mobile phone with 4,300 mAh to a full charge with a whopping 300 watts in just five minutes.

As fascinating as those figures above are, many smartphone users are becoming increasingly concerned. After all, can this be healthy for the mobile phone battery? A legitimate question, which we address in this article. Fi

title: Backing up your backups: Advanced backup tricks for cloud storage
description:
You may have heard that backing up your data with a cloud storage provider isn’t good enough. After all, can you really trust services like Apple iCloud, Microsoft OneDrive, and Google One with your precious documents and photos?

You may recall, for instance, the time that Google Drive temporarily wiped out six months of backups for some users. Then there was the time a software developer obliterated his entire iCloud library by accident, only to be saved by Apple after

title: Churn through your book list with this $50 book summary plan
description:
Want to cover more ground on your book list this year? With a lifetime subscription to 12min, you can get the key insights and ideas from more than 2,500 nonfiction titles in — you guessed it — as little as 12 minutes.

This top-rated platform has earned more than 60,000 reviews on the App Store (4.8/5) and Google Play Store (4.3/5) and has more than six million users worldwide.
